. It is known as a major destination for golf tourists, as the village is surrounded by several golf courses, including
Gullane is located around 20 miles to the east of
, on the A198 road which follows the East Lothian coast. There is a half-hourly bus service to and from Edinburgh and
operated by First Buses, while the nearest train station is 2 miles away at Drem, on the Edinburgh to North Berwick line. Note there are is no regular public transport between Drem and Gullane.

value: is the name for the village's award-winning beach. This is a broad curve of golden sands, backed by large sand dunes, and with rocks at the eastern end, and low cliffs at the western end. Follow any of the side roads running north from the main road through the village to reach the beach. If you've arrived here by car, take the 2nd left after entering the village from the west, which leads to a large car park from where it's a short walk down to the beach. There's usually an ice-cream van here
directions=Adjacent to the Pro Shop at Gullane Golf Club
content=The museum shows how the game developed after it arrived in Scotland from Holland in the 15th Century.
directions=About 3 miles to the south of Gullane, near the village of Drem
price=Adult: £5.50. Concessions:  £4.50. Child 12 and under: Free!. Concorde: £3 adults, £2 Children

content=Aims to tell the history of flight throughout the 20th Century, and has a large collection of aircraft, including British Airways Concorde G-BOAA. Remember to book in advance to see inside Concorde as these tickets are generally sold out on the day. Another rather good attraction (and well worth the look) is the De-Havilland Comet 4C, a derivative of the Worlds first jetliner.
name=The Honourable Company of Edinburgh Golfers
hours=Open to visitors Tues and Thurs
price=£175 for one round and £220 for two rounds (reduced rate Nov-Mar)
content=The Honourable Company of Edinburgh Golfers wrote the first recorded rules of the game in 1744 when they were based at

. They moved to Muirfield in 1891 and the course has been known as one of the World's finest ever since. Visitor bookings are taken up to a year in advance and are taken up very quickly - plan well ahead and take advantage of the online booking system on their website.

content=Three 18-hole links courses, plus a children's course. Both number 1 and 2 courses have been used for qualifying for the Open Championship. Much easier to get a round here compared to Muirfield, but you should still book in advance. Various different deals available throughout the year - check the website. Whilst it's the shortest of the three courses, No. 3 isn't regarded as the 'poor relation' of Nos. 1& 2, with many commentators remarking on its challenging nature. The three 18-hole courses all start from the Western edge of the village, with the children's course (adults only allowed when accompanied by a child!) accessed from the old village green, a short way along the high street.

Bear in mind that there are a wealth of golf courses all along the coastline of East Lothian, virtually one in every town or village.
alt=Hairdressers and stockists of Aveda professional hair products
address=10A Lammermuir Terrace, Gullane (on the main road, east side of the village)

content=Independent hairdressing salon and stockists of Aveda professional hair products. LouLou's is an Aveda Exclusive Salon. A full range of Aveda hair products is available for purchase at the salon.
hours=Lunch 12:30-1:30PM. Dinner 7-8:30PM. Closed Monday and Tuesday
content=Award-winning fine dining restaurant which prides itself on using the best locally-sourced ingredients. Diners travel here from all over south-east Scotland.
directions=At the cross-roads in the centre of the village

content=After a bracing walk on the beach, what better than a hot cup of tea or coffee and a slice of proper Black Forest Gateau? Get that and much more at this German-style bakery, run by the eponymous Falko himself. If you need an "alibi" for tucking into the cakes, there are some delicious savouries on offer as well.
content=Friendly village pub. Also has a restaurant.
content=Family run hotel overlooking the golf courses. 18 rooms.
directions=just off the main road heading east of the village
content=Very highly-rated hotel, designed by the renowned architect Sir Edwin Lutyens in 1901, and retaining an Edwardian style.

The green, rolling East Lothian countryside is all around.
are all pleasant small towns within a few miles of Gullane. Scotland's capital city of
